variant.name: Screen
variant.summary: Screen capture type

variant.name: Window
variant.summary: Window capture type

variant.name: .FrameRate
variant.summary: Frames per second sent, in fps. The value is reported when a stream is removed and is calculated as the total number of frames in this layer, divided by the duration of the call.

variant.name: .Qp
variant.summary: Average quantizer (qp) of frames sent. The value is reported when a stream is removed and is calculated, for this layer, as the sum of all qp values divided the number of frames.

variant.name: .TargetBitrate
variant.summary: Average target bitrate in kbps. The value is reported when a stream is removed and is calculated as the sum of all target bitrates for this layer (sampled after frame has been encoded) divided by the total number of frames for this layer.

variant.name: .Max
variant.summary: The maximum over the time interval

variant.name: .Min
variant.summary: The minimum over the time interval

variant.name: .Value
variant.summary: The last estimated value of the time interval

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Agc.InputClippingRate
histogram.summary: Logs the input clipping rate in AGC1 and in AGC2. A log call is made every 30 seconds during an active WebRTC call using the input volume controller.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Agc2.DigitalGainApplied
histogram.summary: Logs adaptive digital compression gain that is applied by AdaptiveDigitalGainApplier in GainController2. A log call is made once per second. The compression gain is applied to the microphone signal at the end of the processing chain.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Agc2.EstimatedNoiseLevel
histogram.summary: This histogram reports the noise level estimation done in GainController2. A value is reported every second. The unit is inverted dBFS. The scale goes from 0 (very loud noise) to 100 (very faint noise). Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-12-31 to 2022-11-16; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Agc2.FixedDigitalGainCurveRegion.{Region}
histogram.summary: How long the AGC2 limiter remained in the {Region} region. Logged during an active WebRTC call whenever the limiter switches region and at the end of the call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AgcClippingAdjustmentAllowed
histogram.summary: The automatic gain control (AGC) in WebRTC tries to adjust the microphone gain to maintain a strong audio level, but without clipping (saturation). The histogram will log a value every time input clipping is detected. The value is a boolean, with "true" meaning that the gain was in fact adjusted in response to the detected clipping, and "false" meaning that adjustment was not allowed due to limiting boundaries in the algorithm.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Apm.RecommendedInputVolume.OnChangeToMatchTarget
histogram.summary: The recommended input volume when adjusted to match the target level - i.e., not adjusted to handle clipping input. A log call is made every time that such a volume changes during an active WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Apm.{InputVolumeType}.OnChange
histogram.summary: The {InputVolumeType} input volume. A log call is made every time that the volume changes during an active WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Apm.{InputVolumeType}.{Metric}Average
histogram.summary: The {InputVolumeType} input volume average {Metric} measured over 60 seconds in AudioProcessingImpl. A log call is made every 60 seconds during an active WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Apm.{InputVolumeType}.{Metric}Rate
histogram.summary: The {InputVolumeType} input volume {Metric} rate measured over 60 seconds in AudioProcessingImpl. A log call is made every 60 seconds during an active WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ApmCaptureInputLevelAverageRms
histogram.summary: This histogram reports the average RMS of the signal coming in to WebRTC's Audio Processing Module, prior to any WebRTC processing. A new value is reported every 10 seconds, and the average is over the latest interval. The metric is negated dBFS, meaning that 0 is a full-scale signal, while 127 corresponds to -127 dBFS (very faint).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ApmCaptureInputLevelPeakRms
histogram.summary: This histogram reports the peak RMS of the signal coming in to WebRTC's Audio Processing Module, prior to any WebRTC processing. A new value is reported every 10 seconds, and the peak is the RMS of the strongest 10 ms block over the latest interval. The metric is negated dBFS, meaning that 0 is a full-scale signal, while 127 corresponds to -127 dBFS (very faint).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ApmCaptureOutputLevelAverageRms
histogram.summary: This histogram reports the average RMS of the signal in the output of WebRTC's Audio Processing Module, after all audio WebRTC processing. A new value is reported every 10 seconds, and the average is over the latest interval. The metric is negated dBFS, meaning that 0 is a full-scale signal, while 127 corresponds to -127 dBFS (very faint).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ApmCaptureOutputLevelPeakRms
histogram.summary: This histogram reports the peak RMS of the signal in the output of WebRTC's Audio Processing Module, after all WebRTC audio processing. A new value is reported every 10 seconds, and the peak is the RMS of the strongest 10 ms block over the latest interval. The metric is negated dBFS, meaning that 0 is a full-scale signal, while 127 corresponds to -127 dBFS (very faint).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AudioInterruptionMs
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of each audio interruption event. An audio interruption is defined as a loss concealment (a.k.a. expand) event that lasts more than 150 milliseconds. The metric registers each of these events. This gives an indication of the length and prevalence of severe network events, which are likely to be detrimental to the audio quality.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AudioMixer.NewHighestSourceCount
histogram.summary:
Logs the AudioMixer source count whenever the mixer gets a new highest source count. This allows us to differentiate the histogram to get the number of mixers that have had a specific number of maximum sources. For example, the number of AudioMixers that have had a maximum of 5 sources is NewHighestSourceCount[5] - NewHighestSourceCount[6].
Note that this is not the same as logging the source count whenever a source is added; logging only happens when the source count exceeds the previously highest source count.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.AverageExcessBufferDelayMs
histogram.summary: Measures the average waiting time in the buffer for each packet. The waiting time is the time elapsed from the packet arrives until it is decoded. The metric is calculated as the average over one minute, and is logged at the end of each such interval. A well tuned target buffer level should lead to a low value.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.DelayedPacketOutageEventMs
histogram.summary: Measures the duration of each packet loss concealment (a.k.a. expand) event that is not followed by a merge operation. The outage is measured in milliseconds, with a range between 0 and 2000 ms. This gives an indication of how well the jitter buffer's level adaptation is working. If the chosen target level is too low, this value will increase.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.DelayedPacketOutageEventsPerMinute
histogram.summary: Counts the number of delayed packet outage events per minute. The range is between 0 and 100 (corresponds to more 1.6 events per second). See WebRTC.Audio.DelayedPacketOutageEventMs for the definition of a delayed packet outage event, and the interpretation of such events.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.BufferDelay
histogram.summary: This histogram logs half the applied render buffer delay used in the WebRTC echo canceller. The value 0 means that no delay could be estimated, otherwise the logged delay corresponds to the actual delay + 1. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value constitutes the current buffer delay at the time when the value is logged.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.CaptureSaturation
histogram.summary: This histogram logs a value every time the WebRTC echo canceller has detected saturation in the capture signal. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value indicates whether the capture signal has been saturated during the last 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.Clockdrift
histogram.summary: This histogram logs whether clockdrift is detected in the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.DelayChanges
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the frequency of echo path delay changes that are detected by the delay estimator in the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value indicates how frequent delay changes have been during the last 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.EchoPathDelay
histogram.summary: This histogram logs half the estimated echo path delay in 64 sample blocks as seen by the delay estimator in the WebRTC echo canceller. The value 0 means that no delay could be estimated, otherwise the logged delay corresponds to the actual delay + 1. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is the estimate of the delay of the echo path at the time when the value is logged.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.Erle{WebRTCEchoCancellerEstimate}
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo return loss enhancement achieved by the WebRTC echo canceller as described in ITU G.168. When the echo canceller is being used, one value is logged every 10 seconds per ongoing WebRTC call. {WebRTCEchoCancellerEstimate}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.Erl{WebRTCEchoCancellerEstimate}
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the echo return loss achieved by the WebRTC echo canceller as described in ITU G.168. When the echo canceller is being used, one value is logged every 10 seconds per ongoing WebRTC call. {WebRTCEchoCancellerEstimate}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.FilterDelay
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the estimated echo path delay in 64 sample blocks as seen by the linear filter delay in the WebRTC echo canceller. The value 0 means that no delay could be estimated from the linear filter, otherwise the logged delay corresponds to the actual delay + 1. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is the estimate of the filter delay at the time when the value is logged.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.MaxCaptureJitter
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the observed maximum number of capture API calls in a row in the unit of frames (10 ms). A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.MaxRenderJitter
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the observed maximum number of render API calls in a row in the unit of frames (10 ms). A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.MinCaptureJitter
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the observed minimum number of capture API calls in a row in the unit of frames (10 ms). A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.MinRenderJitter
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the observed minimum number of render API calls in a row in the unit of frames (10 ms). A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.PersistentMultichannelContentEverDetected
histogram.summary: This histogram logs whether the WebRTC echo canceller has encountered persistent multichannel playout reference content during its lifetime. The value is logged at the end of the AEC lifetime if the AEC has processed at least 5 seconds of audio.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ProcessingPersistentMultichannelContent
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the frequency of persistent multichannel playout reference content detected by the WebRTC echo canceller. `true` if a majority of the last 10 seconds of audio was classified as persistent multichannel. A new value is logged every 10 seconds.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.ReliableDelayEstimates
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the assessed reliability of the delay estimates produced by the delay estimator in the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is a meausure based on how often during that period the delay estimate was reliable.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.RenderOverruns
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the frequency of overruns in the render buffer of the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is a meausure that indicates how often overruns occurred.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.RenderUnderruns
histogram.summary: This histogram logs the frequency of underruns in the render buffer of the WebRTC echo canceller. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is a meausure that indicates how often underruns occurred.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.EchoCanceller.UsableLinearEstimate
histogram.summary: This histogram logs a value every time the WebRTC echo canceller deems that the linear filter in the echo canceller is sufficiently well adapted to be usable. A new value is logged every 10 seconds and the logged value is the assessment of whether the filter is usable at the time when the value is logged.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.Encoder.CodecType
histogram.summary: Histogram of audio codec usage. Every sample corresponds to 5 seconds of encoding with that codec.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ExpandRatePercent
histogram.summary: Measures the expand rate for an incoming WebRTC audio stream. The expand rate is the fraction of samples that are generated through loss-concealemnt algorithms instead of being decoded from incoming media packets. The metric is calculated as the percent over a 10 second internval, and is logged at the end of each such interval.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ReceiverDelayEstimateMs
histogram.summary: The sum of the jitter buffer delay and the sound card's buffering delay for the receiving side. That is, the sum of the metrics WebRTC.Audio.ReceiverDeviceDelayMs and WebRTC.Audio.ReceiverJitterBufferDelayMs. Sampled once every 10 ms when WebRTC audio is playing. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-07-06 to 2022-08-25; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ReceiverDeviceDelayMs
histogram.summary: The sound card's buffering delay for the receiving side. Sampled once every 10 ms when WebRTC audio is playing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.ReceiverJitterBufferDelayMs
histogram.summary: The jitter buffer delay for the receiving side. Sampled once every 10 ms when WebRTC audio is playing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.SpeechExpandRatePercent
histogram.summary: Measures the audible expand rate for an incoming WebRTC audio stream. The metric is very similar to WebRTC.Audio.ExpandRate, with the difference that this metric only reports loss-concealement that generates audible samples. The metric is calculated as the percent over a 10 second internval, and is logged at the end of each such interval.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.TargetBitrateInKbps
histogram.summary: The target bitrate in kbps that the audio codec should try to produce on average. Sampled every time the rate is updated.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Audio.TargetJitterBufferDelayMs
histogram.summary: The target jitter buffer delay for the receiving side. Sampled once every 10 ms per WebRTC receive stream when WebRTC audio is playing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputChannelLayout
histogram.summary: Audio input channel layout in WebRTC. Logged when a processed audio input source is started, roughly once per successful getUserMedia call with some effect enabled. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-11-01 to 2022-04-11; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputSampleRate
histogram.summary: Audio input sample rate for WebRTC (in Hz). Logged when a processed audio input source is started, roughly once per successful getUserMedia call with some effect enabled. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-11-29 to 2022-04-11; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioInputSampleRateUnexpected
histogram.summary: Audio input sample rate for WebRTC (atypical values, in Hz). Logged when a processed audio input source is started, roughly once per successful getUserMedia call with some effect enabled. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-04-30 to 2022-04-11; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputSampleRate
histogram.summary: Audio output sample rate for WebRTC (in Hz). Logged when a WebRTC MediaStream is connected to an audio output device.

histogram.name: WebRTC.AudioOutputSampleRateUnexpected
histogram.summary: Audio output sample rate for WebRTC (atypical values, in Hz). Logged when a WebRTC MediaStream is connected to an audio output device. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2021-04-30 to 2022-12-07; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.InitialBandwidthEstimate
histogram.summary: The bandwidth estimate 2 seconds into a WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.InitiallyLostPackets
histogram.summary: The number of video packets lost durig the first 2 seconds in a WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.InitialRtt
histogram.summary: The round-trip time as measured 2 seconds into a WebRTC call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.InitialVsConvergedDiff
histogram.summary: The difference between the bandwidth estimate at 2 seconds and 20 seconds into a WebRTC call, with a min at 0, which is supposed to capture the how much the initial bandwidth estimate overshot the actual bandwidth available.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.RampUpTimeTo1000kbpsInMs
histogram.summary: The time it takes the estimated bandwidth to reach 1000 kbps from the first RTCP packet received. Used to measure the bandwidth ramp-up time.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.RampUpTimeTo2000kbpsInMs
histogram.summary: The time it takes the estimated bandwidth to reach 2000 kbps from the first RTCP packet received. Used to measure the bandwidth ramp-up time.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.RampUpTimeTo500kbpsInMs
histogram.summary: The time it takes the estimated bandwidth to reach 500 kbps from the first RTCP packet received. Used to measure the bandwidth ramp-up time.

histogram.name: WebRTC.BWE.Types
histogram.summary:
The bandwidth estimation used in WebRTC calls. Records whether the BWE is running on the sender or the receiver and what BWE related RTP header extensions are in use.
Warning: This histogram was expired from 2022-10-11 to 2022-12-15. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.AudioBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: Average audio bitrate received during a call, counted from first packet received until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.BitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: Average total bitrate received during a call (audio + video + RTCP), counted from first packet received until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.EstimatedSendBitrateInKbps
histogram.summary: Average estimated send bitrate during a call, counted from first packet sent until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.LifetimeInSeconds
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a call. Recorded when a Call instance is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.PacerBitrateInKbps
histogram.summary: Average pacer bitrate during a call, counted from first packet sent until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.RtcpBitrateReceivedInBps
histogram.summary: Average RTCP bitrate received during a call, counted from first packet received until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.TimeReceivingAudioRtpPacketsInSeconds
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the arrival of the first and last audio RTP packets to pass through a Call object. This is logged when the Call object is destroyed. This is only logged if audio RTP packets are at some point in time received, and is a way to omit temporary objects that do not send any actual media.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.TimeReceivingVideoRtpPacketsInSeconds
histogram.summary: The amount of time between the arrival of the first and last video RTP packets to pass through a Call object. This is logged when the Call object is destroyed. This is only logged if video RTP packets are at some point in time received, and is a way to omit temporary objects that do not send any actual media.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Call.VideoBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: Average video bitrate received during a call, counted from first packet received until Call instance is destroyed. Only mesured for calls that are at least 10 seconds long.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelAggregateType
histogram.summary: Recorded when a data channel is created. Counts the combination of reliable and ordered modes in a data channel.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelCounters
histogram.summary: Recorded when a data channel is created. Counts a few main attributes of data channels. Expired in April 2020. Revived in M93.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelMaxPacketLifeTime
histogram.summary: Recorded when a data channel is created. The length of the time window during which transmissions and retransmissions may occur in unreliable mode. It is set to the value used in the configuration when a RTCDataChannel is created.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelMaxRetransmits
histogram.summary: Recorded when a data channel is created. The maximum number of retransmissions that are attempted in unreliable mode. It is set to the value used in the configuration when a RTCDataChannel is created. Expired in M86. Revived in M93.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DataChannelSctpErrorCode
histogram.summary: Recorded when a data channel is closed unexpectedly and the error event is dispatched. Contains the SCTP error code signaled by the transport.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.FrameIsRefresh.{CapturerType}
histogram.summary: A boolean is recorded to this histogram for each provided video frame where the desktop media source is given by {CapturerType}. Sampled as true if the provided frame is a results of a client/sink asking for a refresh frame using the RequestRefreshFrame() API, and sampled as false when the captured frame is newly captured frame not explicitly requested by the client/sink. Very few frames are expected to be marked as refresh frames.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.FrameRate.{CapturerType}
histogram.summary: An integer value is recorded to this histogram for each captured video frame where the desktop media source is of type {CapturerType}. The value is an estimation of the current frame capture rate and the unit is in frames per second.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.IsZeroHzActive.{CapturerType}
histogram.summary: A boolean is recorded to this histogram for each captured video frame where the desktop media source is given by {CapturerType}. Only recorded for capturers that support detection of whether 0Hz is active or not which requires that each captured frame must contain a representation of what regions have been updated since the last frame. Windows WGC is an example of a capturer which does not support this.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.RefreshRate.{CapturerType}
histogram.summary: An integer value is recorded to this histogram each time a client requests a refresh frame using the RequestRefrestFrame() API where the desktop media source is of type {CapturerType}. The value is an estimation of the current refresh-frame rate and the unit is in frames per second.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.Win.DesktopCapturerImpl
histogram.summary: This measures the frequency of use for each desktop capturer implementation, allowing us to measure the adoption of the WGC capturer.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.Win.DirectXCapturerResult
histogram.summary: This records high level errors, or success, encountered across the entire capture flow in the DirectX (DXGI) based capturer. Is recorded every time a new video frame is captured using DXGI. Only recorded on Windows.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.Win.DirectXCursorEmbedded
histogram.summary: A boolean is recorded to this histogram for each captured video frame where the desktop media source is the full screen and a change has been detected in the mouse cursor position. The value is true when the cursor pointer is embedded in the captured desktop image and false if not. It is expected that most display adapters will report false. Only recorded when DirectX (DXGI) is used on Windows.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.Win.WgcCapturerResult
histogram.summary: This records high level errors, or success, encountered across the entire capture flow in the WGC based capturer.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.Win.WgcCaptureSessionGetFrameResult
histogram.summary: This records the result from retrieving a frame from the WGC based capturer.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.Win.WgcCaptureSessionStartResult
histogram.summary: This records the result from starting up the WGC based capturer.

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCapture.Win.{Capturer}CapturerFrameTime
histogram.summary: This measures the performance of the {Capturer} capturer.

variant.name: DirectX
variant.summary: DirectX based

variant.name: Magnifier
variant.summary: Magnifier based

variant.name: ScreenGdi
variant.summary: GDI based screen

variant.name: Wgc
variant.summary: WGC based

variant.name: WindowGdi
variant.summary: GDI based window

histogram.name: WebRTC.DesktopCaptureCounters
histogram.summary: Counters on creation of DesktopCaptureDevice and the first capture call.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ICE.TcpSocketWriteErrorCode
histogram.summary: Counters on different types of TCP socket error code. Collected when we hit the error code when writing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.MediaStreamDevices.HasPanTiltZoomCamera
histogram.summary: Records whether a user would potentially see a permission prompt for moving the camera. It is recorded when showing a camera permission prompt regardless of whether or not the site requested camera movement.

histogram.name: WebRTC.P2P.UDP.BatchingNumberOfReceivedPackets
histogram.summary: This histogram logs how many received UDP packets are batched in a single P2PSocketClient IPC. This is recorded every time the batched received packets transmit over IPC.

histogram.name: WebRTC.P2P.UDP.BatchingNumberOfSentPackets
histogram.summary: This histogram logs how many sent UDP packets are batched in a single P2PSocket IPC. This is recorded every time a batch is transmitted over IPC.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.AddIceCandidate
histogram.summary: Outcomes of adding ICE candidates to a PeerConnection. Used to check the theory that failures in candidate addition are ignored by applications.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.BundlePolicy
histogram.summary:
Determines whether BUNDLE is configured. Recorded during the first DTLS connection establishment. Values are specified in https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-pc/#dom-rtcbundlepolicy
Warning: This histogram was expired from 2022-08-28 to 2022-10-10. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.BundleUsage
histogram.summary:
Determines whether BUNDLE is used in remote offers or answers. Recorded during setRemoteDescription calls. Distinguishes between simple, complex, datachannel-only and legacy plan-b usage.
Warning: This histogram was expired from 2022-08-28 to 2022-10-10. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.CandidatePairType{IPProtocolType}
histogram.summary: Counters of various ICE Endpoint types. These values are logged for the first selected candidate pair of a PeerConnection. {IPProtocolType} Warning: this histogram was expired from 2020-04-05 to 2023-06-16; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.CandidatePoolUsage.{BundlePolicy}
histogram.obsolete: This measurement showed that numbers higher than 1 are in frequent use for all policies. Experiment is no longer needed.
histogram.summary: Measures the configured ice candidate poolsize for the {BundlePolicy} bundlePolicy: https://w3c.github.io/webrtc-pc/#dom-rtcconfiguration-icecandidatepoolsize Recorded during the first DTLS connection establishment. See also WebRTC.PeerConnection.BundlePolicy.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.ConnectionState
histogram.summary:
Counters of ICE Connection states. These values are logged when the PeerConnection gets into that state for the first time or after the ICE restart.
Warning: This histogram was expired from 2022-08-21 to 2022-10-29. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.DtlsHandshakeError
histogram.summary: Records the error whenever the Dtls handshake fails. There are only two types of errors, incompatitable cipher suite and unknown error, for now.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.Duration.Network
histogram.summary:
Duration between the moment the WebRTC network thread's JingleThreadWrapper begins running a task and the moment it ends executing it. It only measures durations of tasks posted to rtc::Thread. Samples are acquired periodically every several seconds by JingleThreadWrapper.
Warning: This metric does not include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|).

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.Duration.Signaling
histogram.summary:
Duration between the moment the WebRTC signaling thread's JingleThreadWrapper begins running a task and the moment it ends executing it. It only measures durations of tasks posted to rtc::Thread. Samples are acquired periodically every several seconds by JingleThreadWrapper.
Warning: This metric does not include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|). solution.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.Duration.Worker
histogram.summary:
Duration between the moment the WebRTC worker thread's JingleThreadWrapper begins running a task and the moment it ends executing it. It only measures durations of tasks posted to rtc::Thread. Samples are acquired periodically every several seconds by JingleThreadWrapper.
Warning: This metric does not include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|).

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IceRegatheringReason
histogram.summary: Records the reasons for ICE re-gathering.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IceRestartState
histogram.summary: Records the transport channel states when ICE restart happens.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IceServers.{MeasuredAt}
histogram.summary: Records the number of configured ICE servers when the peerconnection is created or gets connected, depending on {MeasuredAt}.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPMetrics
histogram.summary: Counters on IPv4 and IPv6 usage in PeerConnection. These values are logged once per PeerConnection. Warning: this histogram was expired from M81 to 2023-06-16; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPv4Interfaces
histogram.summary:
Number of IPv4 network interfaces discovered in a PeerConnection Session.
Warning: This histogram was expired from M81 to M110 Canary (2022-10-29). Data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.IPv6Interfaces
histogram.summary:
Number of IPv6 network interfaces discovered in a PeerConnection Session.
Warning: This histogram was expired from M81 to M110 Canary (2022-10-29). Data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.KeyProtocol
histogram.obsolete: The SDES protocol is no longer available in Chrome as of M98. DTLS is the only possible value.
histogram.summary: What key exchange protocol (DTLS or SDES) is used to establish the crypto keys for a PeerConnection's RTP transport. Note: This histogram was expired after M82, and resurrected in M89.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.Latency.Network
histogram.summary:
Latency defined as the duration between the moment a task is scheduled from the WebRTC network thread's JingleThreadWrapper's task runner, and the moment it begins running. Samples are acquired periodically every several seconds by JingleThreadWrapper.
Warning: This metric does not include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|).

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.Latency.Signaling
histogram.summary:
Latency defined as the duration between the moment a task is scheduled from the WebRTC signaling thread's JingleThreadWrapper's task runner, and the moment it begins running. Samples are acquired periodically every several seconds by JingleThreadWrapper.
Warning: This metric does not include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|).

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.Latency.Worker
histogram.summary:
Latency defined as the duration between the moment a task is scheduled from the WebRTC worker thread's JingleThreadWrapper's task runner, and the moment it begins running. Samples are acquired periodically every several seconds by JingleThreadWrapper.
Warning: This metric does not include reports from clients with low-resolution clocks (i.e. on Windows, ref. |TimeTicks::IsHighResolution()|).

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.Mid.Size
histogram.summary: Records the length of the SDP mid attribute in order to limit its length to 16 characters.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.ProvisionalAnswer
histogram.summary: Whether provisional answers are used. Recorded during the first DTLS connection establishment.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.RtcpMux
histogram.summary:
Whether RTCP-mux is used for the PeerConnection (both the local and remote description enable RTCP-mux). Recorded after SetLocalDescription and SetRemoteDescription are called, once per PeerConnection.
Warning: This histogram was expired from 2020-02-23 to 2022-10-10. Data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.RtcpMuxPolicy
histogram.summary: Which RTCPMuxPolicy was requested for the PeerConnection. Recorded during the first DTLS connection establishment.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpComplexUsage.CreateAnswer
histogram.summary: The SDP usage category ("safe", "unsafe" or "unknown") of createAnswer(). Using complex SDP without explicitly specifying the sdpSemantics is considered unsafe in this context because such usage is sensitive to the rollout of a different default SDP semantic.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpComplexUsage.CreateOffer
histogram.summary: The SDP usage category ("safe", "unsafe" or "unknown") of createOffer(). Using complex SDP without explicitly specifying the sdpSemantics is considered unsafe in this context because such usage is sensitive to the rollout of a different default SDP semantic.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpComplexUsage.SetLocalAnswer
histogram.summary: The SDP usage category ("safe", "unsafe" or "unknown") of setLocalDescription(answer). Using complex SDP without explicitly specifying the sdpSemantics is considered unsafe in this context because such usage is sensitive to the rollout of a different default SDP semantic.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpComplexUsage.SetLocalOffer
histogram.summary: The SDP usage category ("safe", "unsafe" or "unknown") of setLocalDescription(offer). Using complex SDP without explicitly specifying the sdpSemantics is considered unsafe in this context because such usage is sensitive to the rollout of a different default SDP semantic.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpComplexUsage.SetRemoteAnswer
histogram.summary: The SDP usage category ("safe", "unsafe" or "unknown") of setRemoteDescription(answer). Using complex SDP without explicitly specifying the sdpSemantics is considered unsafe in this context because such usage is sensitive to the rollout of a different default SDP semantic.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpComplexUsage.SetRemoteOffer
histogram.summary: The SDP usage category ("safe", "unsafe" or "unknown") of setRemoteDescription(offer). Using complex SDP without explicitly specifying the sdpSemantics is considered unsafe in this context because such usage is sensitive to the rollout of a different default SDP semantic.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpFormatReceived
histogram.summary: What SDP format is received in the remote offer. The value "no tracks" means that no audio or video tracks were received. The value "simple" means that at most one audio and at most one video track was received. The value "complex" means that more than one audio or more than one video track was received, and how this was signaled is indicated ("Plan B" meaning with a=ssrc lines within the same m= section and "Unified Plan" meaning with a separate m= section). This is recorded when calling setRemoteDescription with an SDP Offer.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpFormatReceivedAnswer
histogram.summary: What SDP format is received in the remote answer. See WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpFormatReceived for the description of the values. This is recorded when calling setRemoteDescription with an SDP Answer.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SdpSemanticNegotiated
histogram.summary: What SDP semantic (Unified Plan or Plan B) was detected when completing negotiation of a PeerConnection. This is recorded when accepting an SDP Answer. The value "mixed" means that the accepted answer included both types of marker in the SDP. The value "none" will happen when the answerer sends no media.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.Simulcast.NumberOfSendEncodings
histogram.summary: Counts the number of send encodings given to PeerConnection::AddTransceiver. This histogram will be used to understand if and how the API is used.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SpeedLimit
histogram.summary: Measures computer speed limit state, sampled every 60s when a PeerConnection is open. The value indicates the current operating point in percent of the nominal capacity of the CPUs. The computer decreases the capacity during thermal overload events.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SrtcpUnprotectError
histogram.summary: What error code is reported by libsrtp when failing to unprotect an incoming SRTCP (secured media control) packet.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SrtpUnprotectError
histogram.summary: What error code is reported by libsrtp when failing to unprotect an incoming SRTP (secured media) packet.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SslCipherSuite{WebRTCMediaType}
histogram.summary: Counters on the type of SSL cipher suites used by WebRTC. This is collected whenever the transport signals the OnCompleted event. {WebRTCMediaType}

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.SslPeerSignatureAlgorithm{WebRTCMediaType}
WebRTC.PeerConnection.ThermalState
histogram.summary: Measures computer thermal state, sampled every 60s when a PeerConnection is open with a video sender. Most quick toggles between thermal states are thus not sampled, but thermal states are generally stable so these toggles should be rare.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.ThermalThrottling
histogram.summary: Sampled every 60s when the peer connection is open. True when the computer's speed limit is between 0 and 99 inclusively, false otherwise.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.ThermalThrottlingEpisodes
histogram.summary: The number of thermal throttling episodes the peer connection encountered. Reported when the peer connection is torn down if the peer connection had at least one track.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.UsagePattern
histogram.summary: Capsule history of a WebRTC PeerConnection, encoded as a sequence of bits encapsulated in an integer. Only a few values will be deemed interesting, but the interesting values may change over time.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.ValidBundledPayloadTypes
histogram.summary: Measures whether the remote description contains a payload type collision that is not allowed by the IETFs BUNDLE specification. Enforcing this would allow simplifying the statistics collector. Recorded for every remote description.

histogram.name: WebRTC.PeerConnection.ValidIceChars
histogram.summary: Measures whether the ice-ufrag/ice-pwd consists of characters allowed by the specification. Currently some characters outside the range are allowed for backward compability with deployed software. Recorded during the first DTLS connection establishment.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ReceivedAudioTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of audio tracks received over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter. Warning: this histogram was expired between 2023-04-02 to 2023-04-19; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ReceivedVideoTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of video tracks received over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter. Warning: this histogram was expired from 2022-11-27 to 2022-12-10 and from 2023-04-02 to 2023-04-19; data may be missing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ReliableDataChannelMessageSize
histogram.summary: Sizes of messages sent over reliable data channels. The size of an individual message is added to the histogram as a sample immediately when a message is sent.

histogram.name: WebRTC.ScreenCaptureTime
histogram.summary: Time for capturing one frame in screen capturing.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Screenshare.DesktopCapturerFullscreenDetector
histogram.summary: Tracks the usage of the WebRTC Fullscreen Detector. The Fullscreen Detector is used when capturing presentation applications such as PowerPoint. If the editor window is captured and a slideshow is started in fullscreen mode, the Fullscreen Detector will automatically change so that the fullscreen window is captured. Once the slideshow stops, the editor will be captured again. This is recorded the first time this feature is activated, but only once per screensharing session.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Screenshare.ZeroHz.TimeUntilFirstFrameMs
histogram.summary: The number of milliseconds from the point a zero-Hz frame cadence adapter is created until the first frame arrives from a connected source.

histogram.name: WebRTC.SentAudioTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of audio tracks sent over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.SentVideoTrackDuration
histogram.summary: Durations of video tracks sent over a PeerConnection. The stopwatch starts when the track first becomes connected, and ends when it is disconnected or very soon thereafter.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Stun.BatchSuccessPercent{NatType}
histogram.summary: For clients using a shared source port per STUN binding request toward the specified servers, success rate for requests which received a response with various intervals between requests. Only the first instance of renderers will conduct the trial and log this result. The STUN binding requests are grouped into multiple batches and the success rate is calculated for an individual batch. {NatType}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Stun.Integrity.{StunPacketType}
histogram.summary: Records outcome of integrity checks for STUN requests. This is used in investigation of crbug.com/1177125, in order to figure out if it is safe to turn on checking of these attributes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Stun.ResponseLatency{NatType}
histogram.summary: For clients using a shared source port per STUN binding request, average RTT for requests which received a response with various intervals between requests. Only the first instance of renderers will conduct the trial and log this result. {NatType}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Stun.SuccessPercent{NatType}
histogram.summary: For clients using a shared source port per STUN binding request, success rate for requests which received a response with various intervals between requests. Only the first instance of renderers will conduct the trial and log this result. {NatType}

histogram.name: WebRTC.UnreliableDataChannelMessageSize
histogram.summary: Sizes of messages sent over unreliable data channels. The size of an individual message is added to the histogram as a sample immediately when a message is sent.

histogram.name: WebRTC.UserMediaRequest.NoResultState
histogram.summary:
The state of a UserMediaRequest when it gets destroyed before having a result. Warning: this histogram was expired from M77 to M108(excluded); data may be missing.
Note: "Explicitly Cancelled" means MediaStreamImpl::cancelUserMediaRequest was called and not necessarily that the user cancelled. Those are likely tracked as UserMediaRequest with a result of permission denied.

histogram.name: WebRTC.UserMediaRequest.Result2
histogram.summary: Counters for UserMediaRequests results such as failure reasons. The standard specification error names are in parenthesis.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.AdaptChangesPerMinute{VideoAdaptationReason}
histogram.summary: The average number of adaptation changes per minute for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {VideoAdaptationReason}

variant.name: .Cpu
variant.summary: Adapt reason: CPU.

variant.name: .Quality
variant.summary: Adapt reason: quality.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.AverageRoundTripTimeInMilliseconds
histogram.summary: The average round-trip time of a WebRTC call in milliseconds. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.AVSyncOffsetInMs
histogram.summary: The absolute value of the sync offset between a rendered video frame and the latest played audio frame is measured per video frame. The average offset per received video stream is recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BandwidthLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent frames that are limited in resolution due to bandwidth for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BandwidthLimitedResolutionsDisabled
histogram.summary: For frames that are limited in resolution due to bandwidth, the average number of disabled resolutions is recorded for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of received bits per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.BitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.CpuLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of frames that are limited in resolution due to CPU for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.CurrentDelayInMs
histogram.summary: Average current delay for a received video stream. This is the actual delay imposed on frames (where the goal is to reach the target delay (see WebRTC.Video.TargetDelayInMs)). Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Decoded.Vp8.Qp{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average QP (quantizer value) per frame for a received VP8 video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DecodedFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of decoded frames per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DecodeTimeInMs
histogram.summary: The average decode time per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DelayedFramesToRenderer
histogram.summary: Percentage of delayed frames to renderer for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DelayedFramesToRenderer_AvgDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay of delayed frames to renderer for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DroppedFrames.Capturer
histogram.summary: Total number of frames dropped by a capturer for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DroppedFrames.Encoder
histogram.summary: Total number of frames dropped by an encoder's internal rate limiter for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DroppedFrames.EncoderQueue
histogram.summary: Total number of frames dropped because encoder queue is full for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DroppedFrames.Ratelimiter
histogram.summary: Total number of frames dropped by a WebRTC rate limiter (in MediaOpt) for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.DroppedFrames.Receiver
histogram.summary: Total number of frames dropped by a WebRTC on the receive side because they are incomplete or undecodable.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Encoded.Qp{VideoEncodedQpStats}
histogram.summary: The average QP (quantizer value) per frame for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {VideoEncodedQpStats}

variant.name: .H264
variant.summary: Video codec: H264. QP range: 0-51. No spatial layers.

variant.name: .Vp8
variant.summary: Video codec: VP8. QP range: 0-127. Single stream sent.

variant.name: .Vp8.S0
variant.summary: Video codec: VP8. QP range: 0-127. Spatial index 0.

variant.name: .Vp8.S1
variant.summary: Video codec: VP8. QP range: 0-127. Spatial index 1.

variant.name: .Vp8.S2
variant.summary: Video codec: VP8. QP range: 0-127. Spatial index 2.

variant.name: .Vp9
variant.summary: Video codec: VP9. QP range: 0-255. No spatial layers.

variant.name: .Vp9.S0
variant.summary: Video codec: VP9. QP range: 0-255. Spatial layer 0.

variant.name: .Vp9.S1
variant.summary: Video codec: VP9. QP range: 0-255. Spatial layer 1.

variant.name: .Vp9.S2
variant.summary: Video codec: VP9. QP range: 0-255. Spatial layer 2.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Encoder.CodecType
histogram.summary: Configured video codec for a sent video stream. Recorded when a VideoSendStream is destroyed (for streams whose lifetime is longer than 10 seconds).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.EncodeTimeInMs
histogram.summary: The average encode time per frame for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.EncodingBitrateOvershoot.{WebRtcCodecs}
histogram.summary: The average bitrate overshoot percent for a sent stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.EndToEndDelayInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average end-to-end delay per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.EndToEndDelayMaxInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The maximum end-to-end delay per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.FecBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of received FEC bits per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.FecBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent FEC bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.FirPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP FIR packets per minute for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.FirPacketsSentPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of sent RTCP FIR packets per minute for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.GenericDecoder.CaptureToEncodeDelay
histogram.summary: The time it took between a video frame was captured until it started being encoded. Recorded on the receiving side when a video frame has been decoded using timestamps generated on the sending side if the VideoSendTiming flag is set.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.GenericDecoder.DecodeDelay
histogram.summary: The time it took to decode a video frame. Recorded on the receiving side when a video frame has been decoded using locally generated timestamps.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.GenericDecoder.EncodeDelay
histogram.summary: The time it took to encode a video frame. Recorded on the receiving side when a video frame has been decoded using timestamps generated on the sending side if the VideoSendTiming flag is set.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.GenericDecoder.JitterBufferDelay
histogram.summary: Total time it took to compensate for network jitter of a video frame. Recorded on the receiving side when a video frame has been decoded using locally generated timestamps.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.GenericDecoder.PacerAndPacketizationDelay
histogram.summary: The time a video frame spent in the pacer and packetizer before being transmitted. Recorded on the receiving side when a video frame has been decoded using timestamps generated on the sending side if the VideoSendTiming flag is set.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.GenericDecoder.PacketReceiveDelay
histogram.summary: The time it took to receive a full video frame. Recorded on the receiving side when a video frame has been decoded using locally generated timestamps.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.H264DecoderImpl.Event
histogram.summary: The number of |H264DecoderImpl| events, such as an initialization or decoding error, that have occurred. At most one Init and one Error is reported per |H264DecoderImpl| instance. This is to avoid the same event from being reported multiple times (e.g. if there is an error you might re-initialize or get a decode error every frame which would otherwise pollute the data).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.H264EncoderImpl.Event
histogram.summary: The number of |H264EncoderImpl| events, such as an initialization or encoding error, that have occurred. At most one Init and one Error is reported per |H264EncoderImpl| instance. This is to avoid the same event from being reported multiple times (e.g. if there is an error you might re-initialize or get an encode error every frame which would otherwise pollute the data).

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.HardwareDecodedFramesBetweenSoftwareFallbacks{WebRtcCodecs}
histogram.summary: The number of hardware decoded frames between fallbacks to software decoder for a received video stream. {WebRtcCodecs}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.InputFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of incoming frames per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.InputHeightInPixels
histogram.summary: The average input height per frame (for incoming frames to video engine) for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.InputWidthInPixels
histogram.summary: The average input width per frame (for incoming frames to video engine) for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.InterframeDelay95PercentileInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The 95th percentile of interframe delay for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.InterframeDelayInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average interframe delay for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.InterframeDelayMaxInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The maximum interframe delay for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.JitterBufferDelayInMs
histogram.summary: Average jitter buffer delay for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.KeyFramesReceivedInPermille{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: Permille of frames that are key frames for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.KeyFramesSentInPermille
histogram.summary: Permille of frames that are key frames for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.MeanFreezeDurationMs
histogram.summary: The average duration of a freeze in video playback. Recorded when a received stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.MeanTimeBetweenFreezesMs
histogram.summary: The average duration of a smooth video playback. Recorded when a received stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.MediaBitrateReceivedInKbps{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
WebRTC.Video.MediaBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent media payload bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.NackPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP NACK packets per minute for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.NackPacketsSentPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of sent RTCP NACK packets per minute for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.NumberFreezesPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of video freezes per minute for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.NumberOfPauseEvents
histogram.summary: The number of times a video stream has been paused/resumed during a call. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.NumberResolutionDownswitchesPerMinute
histogram.summary: The average number of resolution down-switches per minute for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.OnewayDelayInMs
histogram.summary: Average delay (network delay (rtt/2) + jitter delay + decode time + render delay) for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PaddingBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of received padding bits per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PaddingBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent padding bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PausedTimeInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of time that the video has been paused for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PliPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP PLI packets per minute for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.PliPacketsSentPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of sent RTCP PLI packets per minute for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.QualityLimitedResolutionDownscales
histogram.summary: For frames that are downscaled in resolution due to quality, the average number of downscales is recorded for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.QualityLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent frames that are downscaled in resolution due to quality for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceivedFecPacketsInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of received FEC packets for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceivedHeightInPixels{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average received height per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceivedPacketsLostInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of received packets lost for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceivedWidthInPixels{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average received width per frame for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ReceiveStreamLifetimeInSeconds
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a video receive stream. Recorded when a VideoReceiveStream instance is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RecoveredMediaPacketsInPercentOfFec
histogram.summary: Percentage of recovered media packets from FEC packets for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RenderFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of sent frames to the renderer per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RenderSqrtPixelsPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of pixels (sqrt(width*height)) of sent frames to the renderer per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of pixels is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RetransmittedBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of retransmitted bits per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RetransmittedBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of retransmitted bits per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RMSEOfEncodingBitrateInKbps.{WebRtcCodecs}
histogram.summary: The RMSE(Root Mean Square Error) between sent bits per second for a sent stream and target bitrate set by WebRTC. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RtpToNtpFreqOffsetInKhz
histogram.summary: The absolute value of the difference between the estimated frequency during RTP timestamp to NTP time conversion and the actual value (i.e. 90 kHz) is measured per received video frame. The max offset during 40 second intervals is stored. The average of these stored offsets per received video stream is recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RtxBitrateReceivedInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of received bits over RTX per second for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.RtxBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent bits over RTX per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.ScalabilityMode
histogram.summary: Counts usage of each scalability mode used to configure the video senders in RTCRtpEncodingParameters from addTransceiver and setParameters APIs. This is part of the WebRTC-SVC specification.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.BandwidthLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent frames that are limited in resolution due to bandwidth for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.BandwidthLimitedResolutionsDisabled
histogram.summary: For frames that are limited in resolution due to bandwidth, the average number of disabled resolutions is recorded for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.BitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.Decoded.Vp8.Qp{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average QP (quantizer value) per frame for a received VP8 screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.DroppedFrames.Capturer
histogram.summary: Total number of frames dropped by a capturer for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.DroppedFrames.Encoder
histogram.summary: Total number of frames dropped by an encoder's internal rate limiter for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.DroppedFrames.EncoderQueue
histogram.summary: Total number of frames dropped because encoder queue is full for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.DroppedFrames.Ratelimiter
histogram.summary: Total number of frames dropped by a WebRTC rate limiter (in MediaOpt) for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.EncodeTimeInMs
histogram.summary: The average encode time per frame for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.EncodingBitrateOvershoot.{WebRtcCodecs}
histogram.summary: The average bitrate overshoot percent for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.EndToEndDelayInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average end-to-end delay per frame for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.EndToEndDelayMaxInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The maximum end-to-end delay per frame for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.FecBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent FEC bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.FirPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP FIR packets per minute for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.FramesPerDrop
histogram.summary: Ratio of sent frames to dropped frames at the encoder. The value is reported when a stream is removed and is calculated as the total number frames sent divided by the number of dropped frames.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.FramesPerOvershoot
histogram.summary: Ratio of sent frames to number of re-encoded frames (due to target bitrate overshoot). The value is reported when a stream is removed and is calculated as the total number frames sent divided by the number of re-encoded frames.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.InputFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of incoming frames per second for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.InputHeightInPixels
histogram.summary: The average input height per frame (for incoming frames to video engine) for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.InputWidthInPixels
histogram.summary: The average input width per frame (for incoming frames to video engine) for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.InterframeDelay95PercentileInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The 95th percentile of interframe delay for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.InterframeDelayInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average interframe delay for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.InterframeDelayMaxInMs{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The maximum interframe delay for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.KeyFramesReceivedInPermille{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: Permille of frames that are key frames for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.KeyFramesSentInPermille
histogram.summary: Permille of frames that are key frames for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.Layer0{ScreenshareLayerStats}
histogram.summary: Stats for the lower layer (TL0) of a screenshare stream in conference mode. {ScreenshareLayerStats}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.Layer1{ScreenshareLayerStats}
histogram.summary: Stats for the higher layer (TL1) of a screenshare stream in conference mode. {ScreenshareLayerStats}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.MeanFreezeDurationMs
histogram.summary: The average duration of a freeze in screenshare playback. Recorded then a received stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.MeanTimeBetweenFreezesMs
histogram.summary: The average duration of a smooth video playback for screenshare stream. Recorded when a received stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.MediaBitrateReceivedInKbps{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The number of received media payload bits per second for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.MediaBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent media payload bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.NackPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP NACK packets per minute for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.NumberResolutionDownswitchesPerMinute
histogram.summary: The average number of resolution down-switches per minute for a receive screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.PaddingBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent padding bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.PliPacketsReceivedPerMinute
histogram.summary: The number of received RTCP PLI packets per minute for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of packets is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.QualityLimitedResolutionDownscales
histogram.summary: For frames that are downscaled in resolution due to quality, the average number of downscales is recorded for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.QualityLimitedResolutionInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent frames that are downscaled in resolution due to quality for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.ReceivedHeightInPixels{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average received height per frame for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.ReceivedPacketsLostInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of received packets lost for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.ReceivedWidthInPixels{WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}
histogram.summary: The average received width per frame for a received screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. {WebRTCVideoExperimentGroupId}

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.ReceiveStreamLifetimeInSeconds
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a screenshare receive stream. Recorded when a VideoReceiveStream instance is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.RetransmittedBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of retransmitted bits per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.RMSEOfEncodingBitrateInKbps.{WebRtcCodecs}
histogram.summary: The RMSE(Root Mean Square Error) between sent bits per second for a sent screenshare stream and target bitrate set by WebRTC. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.RtxBitrateSentInKbps
histogram.summary: The number of sent bits over RTX per second for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of bytes is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SendSideDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay (of average delays) of sent packets for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a frame is input to video engine until a packet is sent to the network. For each sent packet, the average delay of all sent packets over the last second is reported. The average of these reported delays is recorded.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SendSideDelayMaxInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay (of max delays) of sent packets for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a frame is input to video engine until a packet is sent to the network. For each sent packet, the maximum delay of all sent packets over the last second is reported. The average of these reported delays is recorded.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SentFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of sent frames per second for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SentHeightInPixels
histogram.summary: The average sent height per frame for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SentPacketsLostInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent packets lost for a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SentToInputFpsRatioPercent
histogram.summary: Ratio between Screenshare.SentFramesPerSecond and Screenshare.InputFramesPerSecond in percents. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of sent frames is divided by the total number of input frames and multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.SentWidthInPixels
histogram.summary: The average sent width per frame for a sent (screen content) video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.TimeInBlockyVideoPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of time the received screenshare stream playbacks low quality blocky video. Recorded when a stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.TimeInHdPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of time the received screenshare stream playbacks HD resolution. Recorded when a stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.Screenshare.UniqueNackRequestsReceivedInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of unique RTCP NACK requests that are received in response to a sent screenshare stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SendDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average send delay of sent packets for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a packet is sent to the transport until leaving the socket.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SendSideDelayInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay (of average delays) of sent packets for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a frame is input to video engine until a packet is sent to the network. For each sent packet, the average delay of all sent packets over the last second is reported. The average of these reported delays is recorded.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SendSideDelayMaxInMs
histogram.summary: The average delay (of max delays) of sent packets for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The delay is measured from a frame is input to video engine until a packet is sent to the network. For each sent packet, the maximum delay of all sent packets over the last second is reported. The average of these reported delays is recorded.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SendStreamLifetimeInSeconds
histogram.summary: The lifetime of a video send stream. Recorded when a VideoSendStream instance is destroyed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SentFramesPerSecond
histogram.summary: The number of sent frames per second for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of frames is divided by the time the video stream exists.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SentHeightInPixels
histogram.summary: The average sent height per frame for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SentPacketsLostInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of sent packets lost for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SentToInputFpsRatioPercent
histogram.summary: Ratio between SentFramesPerSecond and InputFramesPerSecond in percents. Recorded when a stream is removed. The total number of sent frames is divided by the total number of input frames and multiplied by 100.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.SentWidthInPixels
histogram.summary: The average sent width per frame for a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.TargetDelayInMs
histogram.summary: Average target delay (jitter delay + decode time + render delay) for a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.TimeInBlockyVideoPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of time the receive video stream playbacks low quality blocky video. Recorded when a stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.TimeInHdPercentage
histogram.summary: Percentage of time the receive video stream playbacks HD resolution. Recorded when a stream is removed or content type changes.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.UniqueNackRequestsReceivedInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of unique RTCP NACK requests that are received in response to a sent video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.UniqueNackRequestsSentInPercent
histogram.summary: Percentage of unique RTCP NACK requests that are sent in response to a received video stream. Recorded when a stream is removed.

histogram.name: WebRTC.Video.VP8DecoderImpl.TooManyPendingFrames
histogram.summary: Counts occurences of if the VP8 software decoder runs out of buffers due to that they are not returned to the buffer pool. See http://crbug/652923 and http://crbug/542522.

histogram.name: WebRTC.webkitApiCount
histogram.summary: Counts number of calls to WebRTC APIs from JavaScript.

histogram.name: WebRTC.webkitApiCountPerSession
histogram.summary: Counts the number of calls to WebRTC APIs from JavaScript once per session. A session is a crude estimate since its implemented as the lifetime of the render process that called the WebRTC API.

histogram.name: WebRtcEventLogging.Api
histogram.summary: The result of calls to the API for the collection and uploading of WebRTC event logs.

histogram.name: WebRtcEventLogging.NetError
histogram.summary: NetError returned by the SimpleURLLoader object in charge of uploading a WebRTC event log file.

histogram.name: WebRtcEventLogging.Upload
histogram.summary: Tracks the uploading or discarding of WebRTC event logs that were previously collected.

histogram.name: WebRtcTextLogging.UploadFailureNetErrorCode
histogram.summary: Network error codes for WebRTC text log upload failures. Recorded when an upload attempt fails. Note: The histogram was disabled between May 2022 and M110, so has no data for that period.

histogram.name: WebRtcTextLogging.UploadFailureReason
histogram.summary: Counts upload failures for WebRTC text log. Error codes for network errors are logged in WebRtcTextLogging.UploadFailureNetErrorCode. Recorded when an upload attempt fails.

histogram.name: WebRtcTextLogging{WebRtcLoggingEvent}
histogram.summary: Counts the number of WebRTC text log events per web application. Suffixed by event. {WebRtcLoggingEvent}

variant.name: .UploadFailed
variant.summary: Upload failed

variant.name: .UploadStarted
variant.summary: Upload started

variant.name: .UploadStoredStarted
variant.summary: Upload of a stored log started

variant.name: .UploadSuccessful
variant.summary: Upload successful
